greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of solutions to x^3 - y^3 == 0 (mod n).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(2*floor(2*e/3)) + Sum_{i=0..floor((e-1)/3)} k*(p-1)*p^(e+i-1) where k = 3 if (p = 3 and 3*i+1 = e) or (p mod 3 = 1) otherwise k = 1. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 17 2018
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(v=vector(n)); for(i=0, n-1, v[i^3%n + 1]++); sum(i=0, n-1, v[i+1]^2)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 17 2018
results.author: Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Oct 06 2003
ext: More terms from _John W. Layman_, Oct 18 2003
